titleStmt.title: The profitable adventure to the fortunate: lately begun by Thomas Neale, Esq; their Majesties groom-porter. Having been reported in town, and mentioned in several news letters, to be stopt, and not allowed to go on; for undeceiving all persons that are or may be therein concerned, the contrary is published in several gazettes. And because many that see this, may not (it may be) the printed paper at large, the contents of it is in short thus, (Viz)
titleStmt.author: Neale, Thomas, d. 1699?

titleStmt.title: The profitable adventure to the fortunate: lately begun by Thomas Neale, Esq; their Majesties groom-porter. Having been reported in town, and mentioned in several news letters, to be stopt, and not allowed to go on; for undeceiving all persons that are or may be therein concerned, the contrary is published in several gazettes. And because many that see this, may not (it may be) the printed paper at large, the contents of it is in short thus, (Viz)
titleStmt.author: Neale, Thomas, d. 1699?

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by F. Collins, in the Old Bailey,

notesStmt.note: Signed and dated at end: August 11. 1694. Tho. Neale.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
